summary: A detailed breakdown of the Artlist commercial and behind-the-scenes production video showcasing the creation process, character interactions, thematic elements, and editing details.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a black t-shirt with the word 'Artist' in yellow text, standing in front of a pink and purple grid-patterned background. The individual is gesturing with their hands while speaking. The scene transitions to a dimly lit room where a person in a yellow sweater is sitting at a desk, working on a laptop. The room is illuminated by a warm light from a lamp, and a window reveals a cityscape at night. The person in the yellow sweater is then seen wearing headphones and looking at the laptop screen, which displays a live performance of a band. The band members are visible through the window, with one playing a guitar and another singing into a microphone. The scene shifts to a green screen studio where a person in a red shirt and cap is operating a keyboard, with a camera and other equipment visible in the background. The video then shows a behind-the-scenes look at a film set, where a person in a green jacket and cap is directing a scene with a group of actors, including one with red hair. The set is lit with blue and yellow lights, and various crew members are seen working. The video concludes with the person in the black t-shirt with 'Artist' text, standing in front of the pink and purple grid-patterned background, speaking directly to the camera.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an upbeat introduction from a male speaker, welcoming listeners and promising a breakdown of a commercial's creation, including details on lighting, cinematography, original music, and green screen techniques. Before delving into specifics, he mentions the intention to showcase the commercial, and transition to a more in-depth discussion.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a yellow sweater and headphones around their neck, sitting in front of a laptop adorned with various stickers, including a star and a megaphone. The background is dimly lit with colorful lights, creating a cozy atmosphere. Text appears on the screen, reading "Looking for the best music for your videos?" (¿Buscas la mejor música para tus videos?), suggesting the person is searching for music to enhance their video content. The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying a search bar with the text "Artlist.io" being typed in, indicating the person is searching for music on the Artlist website. The final frame shows a selection of music tracks on the Artlist website, with titles such as "Freedom" by The Orgrass and "Breathe" by Ian Post, highlighting the variety of music available for video projects. The video effectively conveys the process of finding and selecting music for video content using the Artlist platform.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with two male speakers discussing music for videos, with one suggesting checking out "Artlist." This spoken section transitions into a jarring sound effect that seems to emphasize the end of their conversation.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a person in a yellow sweater sitting at a desk, working on a laptop in a dimly lit room with a warm, yellow lamp in the background. The scene transitions to a DJ in an orange jacket and cap, manipulating a turntable and a synthesizer in a room with green-lit windows. The focus shifts to a man in a dark suit holding a microphone, standing in front of a glass window, with a woman in a yellow sweater visible inside the room, working on a laptop. The man appears to be speaking or singing, while the woman continues her work. The scene then returns to the person in the yellow sweater, now wearing headphones, with a group of people in the background, including a man in a yellow shirt and a woman with red hair. The video continues with a close-up of the person in the yellow sweater, still wearing headphones, with the same group of people in the background. The text 'The License covers' appears on the screen, followed by 'The License covers all the rights to the music.' The scene transitions back to the person in the yellow sweater, putting on headphones, with the warm, yellow lamp in the background. The video concludes with the person in the yellow sweater, now wearing headphones, sitting at the desk with a laptop and a monitor, with a cityscape visible through the window behind them.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male voice announcing, "Ladies and gentlemen, I give you freedom," in a grand, theatrical tone. This is followed by a dance track with a somewhat retro, upbeat vibe, layered with the word "freedom" repeated rhythmically, possibly sampled or sung. The track features a bassline, and synthetic instrumental elements. Interjected into the music is the male voice again, proclaiming, "And the license covers everything". As the music continues, the male voice returns, urging the listener to "go to Harvest now and start creating, start right now". Finally, the music fades out with a high-pitched rising tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a person wearing a black t-shirt with the word "Artlist" printed in yellow on the front, standing in front of a pink and black grid background. The scene transitions to a dimly lit room where a person is sitting at a desk with a laptop, surrounded by various objects, including a plant and a lamp. The room has a cozy atmosphere with a window showing city lights in the background. The video then returns to the person in the black t-shirt, who appears to be speaking and gesturing with their hands. The scene shifts to a close-up of a laptop screen displaying a music editing software interface, with a person's hands typing on the keyboard. The video then shows a person operating a turntable, adjusting the needle on a vinyl record. The final scene features a green screen studio where three people are present: one person is playing a guitar, another is standing with a microphone, and the third is operating a sound mixing console. The studio is equipped with professional lighting and camera equipment, creating a professional atmosphere. Throughout the video, the person in the black t-shirt continues to speak, providing context and information about the scenes depicted.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male speaker, who has a casual and excited tone, describing a commercial and highlighting its unique features, such as an editor, a band performing live in the background, and the original song made for the commercial. This transitions into an upbeat pop song with a catchy rhythm, soulful vocals, and a blend of modern beats and classic instruments like guitar and keys. The female vocals sing, "It's all for you," multiple times. Suddenly, the audio changes as a male voice shouts the word "Freedom!" seemingly within the song, adding an element of excitement and energy. The original male speaker resumes his narration in a casual tone, mentioning that the musicians performing are actually the artists who created the song.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a man wearing a black t-shirt with the word 'Artlist' in yellow, standing in front of a pink and black grid background. The scene transitions to a dimly lit room where a man in a yellow shirt and black jacket sings into a microphone, accompanied by two other individuals, one playing an orange instrument and the other clapping. The room is illuminated by blue and yellow lights, with a cityscape visible through a window. The video then returns to the man in the black t-shirt, who continues to speak in front of the same background. A close-up of a computer screen displays a document titled 'Lyrics (first draft)' with the text 'Part one - Search is over' highlighted in yellow. The scene shifts to a music production software interface, showcasing a list of songs with the text 'New music' in yellow and white. The video concludes with the man in the black t-shirt speaking again, followed by a close-up of the man in the yellow shirt singing into the microphone, with the cityscape still visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a man stating that the main value in the commercial was "freedom," and specifically, the creative freedom to express yourself. He continues describing that the song needed to have a certain type of energy, so they chose something upbeat, carefree, funky, and happy. He mentions that the lyrics were not literal, then provides two examples from the song: "So fresh, so new," referring to the music catalog being updated, and "It's all for you," indicating that everything is for the creators using the platform. Music then plays, which is upbeat and funky with lyrics like "So fresh, so new," and "Freedom, it's all for you." The man speaking is enthusiastic and conversational.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a black t-shirt with the word "Artlist" printed in yellow on the front, standing in front of a background with a grid pattern of pink and purple panels. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his head slightly shifts position. The scene then transitions to a behind-the-scenes look at a production set, where a man in a white shirt with a blue stripe on the sleeve is seen sitting in a dimly lit room, watching multiple screens displaying video footage. The word "Production" is prominently displayed on the screen, indicating the context of the scene. The video then cuts to a green screen studio where a group of people, including a man in a suit and a woman with red hair playing a guitar, are performing. The word "Production" is again displayed on the screen, reinforcing the theme of the video. The video concludes with a return to the man in the black t-shirt, who continues to speak in front of the pink and purple grid background, maintaining the same setting and attire as the initial scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker encouraging listeners to like and subscribe to the YouTube channel, emphasizing that more content is being created. His tone is enthusiastic and engaging. Subsequently, the audio transitions into background music that is generally upbeat and modern. Finally, the male speaker returns, signaling a shift back to speech and introducing the main topic of discussion as diving into "the actual production."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person standing in front of a pink and black grid background, wearing a black t-shirt with the yellow text 'Artlist' on it. The scene transitions to a behind-the-scenes look at a film set, where two individuals are adjusting large lights on ladders against a green screen backdrop. The next scene shows a person sitting at a desk with a laptop, wearing headphones, and surrounded by various items, including a plant and a cup. The video then shifts to a different set where three people are performing in front of a green screen, with one playing a guitar, another holding a microphone, and the third playing a keyboard. The final scene returns to the initial person in front of the pink and black grid background, who appears to be speaking and gesturing with their hands. The video provides a glimpse into the production process of a film or video, showcasing the technical aspects and the creative environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker detailing the use of a green screen studio to create the illusion of a band appearing outside a window, explaining how they constructed a set with a window and divided the studio into two sections, an editor's room and the outside. The speaker describes how they shot the two setups separately to allow flexibility and emphasized the importance of adapting their approach due to the performers being musicians rather than actors. They suggests ways to bring the energy of live performance to the set, like creating excitement or bringing in large speakers to simulate live settings. The speaker says, "The key is to make them feel like they're performing live in order to get those reactions you were looking for." The audio is primarily speech, with the speaker maintaining a clear and informative tone throughout.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a display of five classic paintings, each showcasing a distinct color palette, set against a dark background with the words "Color palette" prominently displayed in yellow at the top. The paintings include a dramatic seascape, a portrait of a young girl with a blue headscarf, a figure in a yellow cloak, a portrait of a young man in a military uniform, and a bearded man in a contemplative pose. The scene transitions to a collage of modern interior design images, featuring living rooms and color swatches in shades of yellow, teal, and gray, with the Pantone color code 7407 U highlighted. The video then shifts to a dimly lit room where a person in a yellow sweater is seated at a desk with a laptop, surrounded by plants and a green screen in the background. The person appears to be working, with another individual visible through the green screen. The scene continues with the person adjusting their hair and interacting with the laptop, maintaining a warm and cozy atmosphere. The video concludes with a person wearing a black t-shirt with the word "Artlist" in yellow, standing in front of a pink and purple grid background, gesturing as if explaining or presenting something. The overall narrative connects classic art with modern design and creative workspaces, emphasizing the use of color in both historical and contemporary contexts.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing the color palette of a production, focusing on the use of yellows as the "artist's brand color." He points out the appearance of yellows in various parts of the scene and the inclusion of blues and greens to create color contrast. Transitioning, he suggests that brands and influencers should consider color palettes when making videos.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a bright light source, possibly a studio light, with a blue grid pattern on its side, indicating a controlled lighting setup. The scene transitions to a wider view of a studio environment, where a person is seated at a desk with a laptop, surrounded by various studio equipment, including a green screen backdrop, suggesting a video production setting. The person appears to be working on the laptop, with a focused expression. The camera then shifts to show another individual adjusting equipment, possibly a camera or lighting setup, indicating active preparation for a shoot. The next frames show a monitor displaying a live feed of the person at the desk, wearing headphones and looking towards the camera, with the green screen visible in the background. The monitor displays technical details such as frame rate (FPS), shutter speed, and exposure settings, emphasizing the technical aspects of the production. The scene then transitions to a person in a gray t-shirt, holding a smartphone and a piece of clothing, possibly discussing or reviewing something related to the shoot. The video continues with a view of a studio light with a blue hue, illuminating the green screen backdrop, and then shifts to a wider shot of the person at the desk, now with a cityscape visible through the window, adding a dynamic background to the scene. The video concludes with a close-up of the person at the desk, with the cityscape still visible, and the text 'Artlist' appearing in the top left corner, indicating the source or platform associated with the video. The overall atmosphere is one of focused creativity and technical precision in a professional studio setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker introducing a discussion about "lighting setups". He then details lighting arrangements in "the editor's room," describing LED panels for fill lights, a white solid projecting soft light onto subjects' faces for key light, and an Asteras tube for hair light. He also mentions an ARRI SkyPanel set to blue, simulating moonlight through a window, to match the "nighttime city look".

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a behind-the-scenes look at a film or video production set. It begins with a group of people, including a man with a camera and a woman with red hair, working together in a dimly lit room with green and blue lighting. The scene transitions to a woman in a yellow sweater sitting at a desk, working on a laptop, with a large screen behind her displaying a man and a woman singing. The camera then shifts to show the man and woman singing in front of a microphone, with the woman in the yellow sweater visible through a window in the background. The video continues to show various angles of the production set, including a man in a yellow sweater sitting at a desk with a laptop, and a group of people working with cameras and lighting equipment. The final scenes depict the set being prepared, with people adjusting lighting and equipment, and the overall atmosphere of a busy and creative production environment. The text 'Artlist' appears in the top left corner of the screen, indicating the platform or service associated with the production.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker describing the lighting setup for a reverse shot, mentioning the need to light both the band and the editor. He explains using an Asteria light with a diffuser for the editor's key light and an ARRI SkyPanel for the band's moonlight. He continues by describing stage lights hung from the ceiling set to tungsten as their key light. The background contains music that seems to be electronic, generating a tense and moody atmosphere, with synthesizer sounds prominent.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with two individuals standing on ladders, adjusting large studio lights in a room with a green screen background. The scene transitions to a studio setup where a person in a suit stands in front of a microphone, while another person plays a guitar and a third person sits at a podium with a microphone. The studio is equipped with professional lighting and camera equipment, and the green screen suggests that the footage will be used for post-production effects. The focus then shifts to a close-up of a person wearing a black t-shirt with the word "Artlist" printed in yellow on the front, standing in front of a background with the same "Artlist" logo. The person appears to be speaking or presenting, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The video maintains a professional and creative atmosphere throughout, highlighting the process of video production and the branding of "Artlist."
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing the lighting setup for a green screen, including lantern lights and ASTERA tube lights for hair light, in a factual and informative tone. He then invites viewers to learn more about working with green screens, mentioning a video linked in the description. A brief and generic music sting or transition plays, then the clip abruptly stops.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black t-shirt with the word "Artlist" printed in yellow on the front, standing in front of a background with a grid pattern of pink and purple panels. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The lighting is soft and evenly distributed, highlighting the man's face and upper body. The background remains consistent, with the "Artlist" logo visible on the panels behind him. The video transitions to a dimly lit room where a person is seen from behind, watching a monitor displaying a video. The text "Watch more Artlist" appears in yellow at the top of the screen, suggesting that the video is part of a series or promotional content for Artlist. The scene then shifts to a behind-the-scenes view of a film set, with crew members working and equipment visible, including a large softbox light and a camera on a tripod. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused on the production process.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a friendly and engaging male speaker wrapping up a video, encouraging viewers to "slap that like button" and subscribe for more content.  He then shifts to announcing a giveaway of a free subscription.  A brief celebratory sound effect marks the announcement of a winner from a previous giveaway, followed by words of congratulation and encouragement to "stay creative."  A short, upbeat hip-hop track comes in, with a prominent, distorted 808 bass and a catchy rhythm. Throughout the clip, there are prominent whooshing and swooshing sound effects layered over the speech and music, contributing to a dynamic and energized mood.
